bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]Mr. BARR:H.R. 2570.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 14, which gives Congress thepower ``to make rules for the government and regulation ofthe land and naval forces.'' This is appropriate because thislegislation involves the U.S. Coast Guard and licensingregulations for the captains of ships.____________________[Page H4145]

summary.text: Exempts the vessel John Craig from certain requirements when operating on a portion of the Kentucky River.

bill.title: Valley View Ferry Preservation Act of 2013

item.title: Valley View Ferry Preservation Act of 2013
To exempt the vessel John Craig from certain requirements when operating on a portion of the Kentucky River, and for other purposes.
Valley View Ferry Preservation Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
